instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3_OUT: What is PPVRTC_G3_OUT? PPVRTC_G3_OUT is a 3.3v power line that comes out of the clock chip. .
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: 820 3023 water damage
threads.message:
820 3023 No power, i have green light on mag safe, quarter fan spin, board looked over all in good shape, I replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q5060</TRANSISTOR>, it was the only spot corroded. Can't find any shorted lines.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.41v
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_SW_T29BST</SIGNAL> pulsing .121v-.007v
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> 8.41v
<SIGNAL>PP18V5_DCIN</SIGNAL> 16.41V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.41V
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3_OUT</SIGNAL> 3.30V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 5.02V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_SUS_FET</SIGNAL> 5.02V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> 0V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_FET</SIGNAL> pulsing .245v-.026v

<SIGNAL>T29_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> pulsing 2.2v-.089v

threads.title: 820 3023 water damage
threads.message: If <TRANSISTOR>Q5060</TRANSISTOR> was corroded there is likely crap under the SMC or the termination resistors from <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> are corroded (<RESISTOR>R5110</RESISTOR> and friends, 12pcs)

threads.title: 820 3023 water damage
threads.message: Thanks Duke, you are the man! It was <RESISTOR>R5111</RESISTOR>, pad on <SIGNAL>SPI_CLK_R</SIGNAL> was shot, running now.
